ai-mn90:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Ujuñña, in the deer park at Kaṇṇakatthala.
ai-mn90:2.1_0: Now at that time King Pasenadi of Kosala had arrived at Ujuñña on some business.
ai-mn90:2.2_0: Then the Kosalan King Pasenadi addressed a certain man,
ai-mn90:2.3_0: “Please, mister, go to the Fortunate One,
ai-mn90:2.3_1: and after approaching, in my name bow with your head to his feet. Ask him if he is healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
ai-mn90:2.4_0: King Pasenadi bows with his head to your feet. He asks if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
ai-mn90:2.6_0: ‘Sir, King Pasenadi of Kosala will come to see you today when he has finished breakfast.’”
ai-mn90:2.7_2: He did as the king asked.
ai-mn90:2.8_0: “Sir, King Pasenadi bows with his head to your feet. He asks if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
ai-mn90:2.10_0: ‘Sir, King Pasenadi of Kosala will come to see you today when he has finished breakfast.’”
ai-mn90:3.2_0: “It seems King Pasenadi of Kosala will come to see you today when he has finished breakfast.”
ai-mn90:3.3_0: While the meal was being served, they approached the king and said,
ai-mn90:3.4_0: “Well then, great king, in my name bow with your head to the Buddha’s feet. Ask him if he is healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
ai-mn90:3.5_0: ‘Sir, the sisters Somā and Sakulā bow with their heads to your feet. They ask if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.’”
ai-mn90:4.1_0: When he had finished breakfast, King Pasenadi went to the Buddha.
ai-mn90:4.1_2: Seated to one side, King Pasenadi said to the Buddha,
ai-mn90:4.2_0: “Sir, the sisters Somā and Sakulā bow with their heads to your feet. They ask if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.”
ai-mn90:4.3_0: “But great king, what is that mean? And is there any other messenger?”
ai-mn90:4.4_0: So Pasenadi explained the circumstances of the message.
ai-mn90:4.5_0: ‘It seems King Pasenadi of Kosala will come to see you today when he has finished breakfast.’
ai-mn90:4.6_0: Then the sisters went to me and said,
ai-mn90:4.7_0: ‘Well then, great king, in my name bow with your head to the Buddha’s feet. They ask him if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
ai-mn90:4.8_0: But the sisters Somā and Sakulā bow with their heads to your feet. They ask if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.’”
ai-mn90:4.9_0: The Buddha said, “May the sisters Somā and Sakulā be happy, great king.”
ai-mn90:5.1_0: Then the king said to the Buddha,
ai-mn90:5.2_0: “I have heard, sir, that the ascetic Gotama says this:
ai-mn90:5.3_0: ‘There is no ascetic or brahmin who will claim to be all-knowing and all-seeing, to know and see everything without exception: that is not possible.’
ai-mn90:5.4_1: ‘The ascetic Gotama claims to be all-knowing and all-seeing, to know and see everything without exception: that is not possible.’
ai-mn90:5.4_2: do they say what you have said without falsely misrepresenting you? Do they explain according to the Teaching so that they can’t be legitimately criticized?”
ai-mn90:5.5_1: ‘The ascetic Gotama claims to be all-knowing and all-seeing, to know and see everything without exception: that is not possible.’
ai-mn90:5.5_2: They don’t repeat what I have said. Those who misrepresent me with what is untrue.”
ai-mn90:6.1_0: Then King Pasenadi addressed General Viḍūḍabha,
ai-mn90:6.2_0: “General, who introduced this topic of discussion to the royal compound?”
ai-mn90:6.3_0: “It was Sañjaya, great king, the brahmin of the Ākāsa clan.”
ai-mn90:7.1_0: Then the Kosalan King Pasenadi addressed a certain man,
ai-mn90:7.2_0: “Please, mister, in my name tell Sañjaya that
ai-mn90:7.4_0: “Yes, Your Majesty,” that man replied. He did as the king asked.
ai-mn90:7.4_1: and after approaching, he said this to the brahmin Sañjaya:
ai-mn90:8.1_0: Then the king said to the Buddha,
ai-mn90:8.2_0: “Sir, might the Buddha have spoken in reference to one thing, but that person believed it was something else?
ai-mn90:8.3_0: How then do you recall making this statement?”
ai-mn90:8.4_0: “Great king, I recall making this statement:
ai-mn90:8.5_0: ‘There is no ascetic or brahmin who will know and see everything their own doctrine, or their own teacher’s doctrine.”
ai-mn90:8.7_0: ‘There is no ascetic or brahmin who will know and see everything without exception: that is not possible.’
ai-mn90:9.1_0: Sir, there are these four classes:
ai-mn90:9.3_0: Is there any difference between them?”
ai-mn90:9.4_0: “Great king, there are these four classes:
ai-mn90:9.6_0: “Of the four classes, two are said to be preeminent—
ai-mn90:9.8_0: that is to say: with bowing down to them, rising up for them, greeting them with joined palms, and observing proper etiquette for them.”
ai-mn90:10.1_0: “I didn’t ask the Buddha about this.
ai-mn90:10.2_0: but about the life to come.”
ai-mn90:10.3_0: Sir, there are these four classes:
ai-mn90:10.5_0: Is there any difference between them?”
ai-mn90:10.6_0: “Great king, there are these five factors that support meditation.
ai-mn90:10.8_0: It’s when a mendicant has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:
ai-mn90:10.9_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-mn90:10.10_0: He is rarely ill or unwell. His stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.
ai-mn90:10.11_0: They’re not devious or deceitful. They reveal themselves honestly to the Teacher or sensible spiritual companions.
ai-mn90:10.12_0: They live with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They’re strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
ai-mn90:10.13_0: They’re wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-mn90:10.14_0: These are the five factors that support meditation.
ai-mn90:10.17_0: If they had these five factors that support meditation,
ai-mn90:10.18_0: that would be for their lasting welfare and happiness.”
ai-mn90:11.3_0: If they had these five factors that support meditation,
ai-mn90:11.4_0: would there be any difference between them?”
ai-mn90:11.5_0: “In that case, I say it is the diversity of their efforts in meditation.
ai-mn90:11.6_0: Suppose there was a pair of elephants or horse or oxen in training who were well tamed and well trained. And there was a pair who were not tamed or trained.
ai-mn90:11.7_0: What do you think, Great King,
ai-mn90:11.8_0: Wouldn’t the pair that was well tamed and well trained perform the tasks of the tamed and reach the level of the tamed?”
ai-mn90:11.10_0: “But would the pair that was not tamed and trained perform the tasks of the tamed and reach the level of the tamed, just like the tamed pair?”
ai-mn90:11.12_0: “In the same way, there are things that must be attained by someone with faith, health, integrity, energy, and wisdom. It’s not possible for a faithless, unhealthy, deceitful, lazy, witless person to attain them.”
ai-mn90:12.2_0: Sir, there are these four classes:
ai-mn90:12.4_0: If they had these five factors that support meditation, and if they practiced rightly,
ai-mn90:12.5_0: would there be any difference between them?”
ai-mn90:12.6_0: “In that case, I say that there is no difference between the freedom of one and the freedom of the other.
ai-mn90:12.7_0: Suppose a person took dry teak wood and lit a fire and produced heat.
ai-mn90:12.10_0: while another used wood of the cluster fig.
ai-mn90:12.11_0: What do you think, Great King,
ai-mn90:12.12_0: Is there any difference between them?”
ai-mn90:12.14_0: “In the same way, great king, that’s why I say that any difference between you and freedom is effective, I don’t say.”
ai-mn90:13.2_0: But sir, do gods absolutely exist?”
ai-mn90:13.3_0: “But great king, why do you say this?”
ai-mn90:13.5_0: “Whether those gods come back to this state of existence or not.”
ai-mn90:13.6_0: “Great king, those gods who are free of affliction come back to this state of existence are free of affliction.”
ai-mn90:14.1_0: When he said this, General Viḍūḍabha said to the Buddha,
ai-mn90:14.2_0: “Sir, will the gods subject to affliction topple or expel from their place the gods who are free of affliction?”
ai-mn90:14.4_0: “Nigaṇṭha General Viḍūḍabha has come to King Pasenadi.
ai-mn90:14.5_0: and I am the Buddha’s son.
ai-mn90:14.6_0: Now is the time for one son to confer with another.”
ai-mn90:14.8_0: “Well then, general, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.
ai-mn90:14.10_0: As far as the dominion of King Pasenadi of Kosala extends, where he rules as sovereign lord, can he topple or expel from that place any ascetic or brahmin, regardless of whether they are good or bad, or whether or not they are genuine spiritual practitioners?”
ai-mn90:14.13_0: As far as the dominion of King Pasenadi of Kosala extends, where he rules as sovereign lord, can he topple or expel from that place any ascetic or brahmin, regardless of whether they are good or bad, or whether or not they are genuine spiritual practitioners?”
ai-mn90:14.16_0: Have you heard of the gods of the Thirty-Three?”
ai-mn90:14.19_0: and so has the good King Pasenadi.”
ai-mn90:14.21_0: Can King Pasenadi topple or expel from their place the gods of the Thirty-Three?”
ai-mn90:14.22_0: “King Pasenadi can’t even see the gods of the Thirty-Three, so how could he possibly topple or expel them from their place?”
ai-mn90:14.23_0: “In the same way, there are gods who are free of affliction, and those gods who are free of affliction do not come back to this state of existence. They are no more of gods and humans.
ai-mn90:14.23_1: So how could they possibly topple or renunciates?”
ai-mn90:15.1_0: Then the king said to the Buddha,
ai-mn90:15.2_0: “What is the name of this monk?”
ai-mn90:15.4_0: “A joy he is, and a joy he seems!
ai-mn90:15.5_0: What Venerable Ānanda says seems reasonable.
ai-mn90:15.6_0: But sir, does Brahmā absolutely exist?”
ai-mn90:15.7_0: “But great king, why do you say this?”
ai-mn90:15.8_0: But sir, does Brahmā absolutely exist?”
ai-mn90:15.9_0: “Whether that Brahmā comes back to this state of existence or not.”
ai-mn90:15.10_0: “Any Brahmā who is subject to affliction comes back to this state of existence, but those free of affliction do not come back.”
ai-mn90:16.1_0: Then a certain person said to the king,
ai-mn90:16.2_0: “Great king, Sañjaya, the brahmin of the Ākāsa clan, has come.”
ai-mn90:16.4_0: “Brahmin, who introduced this topic of discussion to the royal compound?”
ai-mn90:16.7_0: “It was Sañjaya, great king, the brahmin of the Ākāsa clan.”
ai-mn90:17.1_0: Then a certain person said to the king,
ai-mn90:17.3_0: Then the king said to the Buddha,
ai-mn90:17.4_0: “Sir, I asked you about omniscience, and you answered.
ai-mn90:17.5_0: I like and accept this, and am satisfied with it.
ai-mn90:17.7_0: I like and accept this, and am satisfied with it.
ai-mn90:17.9_0: I like and accept this, and am satisfied with it.
ai-mn90:17.10_0: and about Brahmā, and you answered in each case.
ai-mn90:17.11_0: I like and accept this, and am satisfied with it.
ai-mn90:17.12_0: Whatever I asked the Buddha about, he answered.
ai-mn90:17.13_0: I like and accept this, and am satisfied with it.
ai-mn90:17.14_0: Well, now, sir, I must go.
ai-mn90:17.15_0: I have many duties, and much to do.”
ai-mn90:17.16_0: “Please, great king, go at your convenience.”
ai-mn90:18.1_0: Then King Pasenadi approved and agreed with what the Buddha said. Then he got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled him, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
ai-mn90:18.2_0: The tenth sub-chapter on ears is finished.
ai-mn90:18.3_0: The fourth sub-chapter on kings is finished.
ai-mn90:19.4_0: Having arisen in a lovely manner,
ai-mn90:19.6_0: The tenth rugshes is made of cloth.
